flawed_nl_solution:
The additional yard he will be able to run to after improving his speed is 40 x 40/100 = <<40*40/100=16>>16 yards.
So the total yard he will be able to run to after improving his speed is 40 + 16 = <<40+16=57>>57 yards in 5 seconds.
Therefore the total yards he will be able to run to within 10 seconds is 57 x 2 = <<57*2=114>>114.
#### 114

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 56, not 57. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
